DOC.brief_summary: In patient severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease ( COPD ) , exercise tolerance severely impaired due ventilatory limitation , level intensity exercise . This reduce physiological benefit pulmonary rehabilitation . In patient , propose add Inspiratory Pressure Support ( IPS ) order increase intensity duration every training session . In preliminary study , investigator show IPS apply exhaustive cycling exercise allow prevent onset post-exercise quadriceps fatigue evaluate endurance time isotonic quadriceps contraction ( TlimQ ) . The aim study determine relationship prevention post-exercise fatigue ( TlimQ ) change train load ( intensity x time x number session ) pulmonary rehabilitation programme . At begin train programme , 25 patient evaluate TlimQ cycling exercise ( 70 % maximal workload ) without IPS random order . The training load monitor every exercise session programme .
DOC.brief_title: Prevention Post-exercise Muscle Fatigue Effect Exercise Training Severe Patients With COPD .
